result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

22CF49 & 22CF122 Cases called @ 1:05 PM Defendant Percy J. Schmelzle appeared by phone.  Attorney Matthew Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Evan J Dahl appeared by phone for Percy J. Schmelzle. Receipt of complaint Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court entertains wavier of the preliminary hearing in both cases. Cases 22CF122 & 22CF49 called @ 1:40 PM Defendant Percy J. Schmelzle in court, in custody.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by Court regarding SPD appointment status. The Court will appoint an attorney to represent the DE in both matters. The Court finds good cause exists to adjourn the AIA and extend any timelines relevant to the Preliminary Hearing to allow appointment to take place. AIA scheduled - NOH given. Statement by ADA Ryan regarding bond modification request by DE. Bond modification argument by ADA Ryan. The Court respectfully declines bond modification.
